title: Wedding Crashers
description: John and his buddy, Jeremy are emotional criminals who know how to use a woman's hopes and dreams for their own carnal gain. Their modus operandi: crashing weddings. Normally, they meet guests who want to toast the romantic day with a random hook-up. But when John meets Claire, he discovers what true love – and heartache – feels like.

reviews.text: Wedding Crashers in a great movie. Vince Vaughn is fantastic! Christopher Walken is great too. It's hilarious-filled with non-stop laughs. Don't miss it.

I remember watching this film in the cinema's and at the time is was hilarious and the best LOL i'd seen in a while. After watching it again and again its pretty clear that Wedding Crashers is still to date one of the best and most memorable comedies of recent times. It follows John Beckwith (Owen Wilson) and Jeremy Grey (Vince Vaughn)  a set of divorce mediators who are also "Wedding Crashers." They go from wedding to wedding, girl to girl and live the lifestyle that men dream off but at the "Kentucky Derby" of weddings - The U.S Secretary of Treasure William Cleary's (Christopher Walken) daughter that all changes when John falls for his other daughter Claire (Rachel McAdams). What unfolds is an unforgettable and hysterical series of events and some of the most memorable one-liners and quotes as John sets about wooing Claire from under the arms of Sack (portrayed superbly by Bradley Cooper), Jeremy has to deal with his "stage 5 virgin clinger" Gloria. Its an unimssable comedy that regardless of when watched will always manage to put a smile on your face and LOL, cracking comedy and one of the best!
Good screenplay, good cast, good story and excellent movie. Wedding Crashers is one of those comedies which are able to make laugh without be too vulgar and irritating.

One of the Smartest and most original comedies I have seen so far. Wedding Crashers is hilarious, heartfelt and raunchy. Owen Wilson and Vins Vaughn are great in this film and their chemistry makes it even better!

This movie is a classic to me. Everything was designed to make you laugh. Owen Wilson and Vince Vaughn really complimenting each other performance to the max. They are perfect. The whole Cleary's family are funny and so full of character. As a bonus, they add a very special scene with Will Ferrell. That scene was hilarious and legendary. You can't have it this way anymore in 2017. If Hollywood decides to make another one of this today,  I can imagine Twitter will be in full rage, burning buildings, rants, and riots in all 69 states.If you haven't seen it already, I absolutely recommend Wedding Crashers to anyone who wants to laugh and keep laughing (with an open mind ofc).

Holy God, what a piece of Hollywood Crap! What's so baffling is the number of critics who actually pretended to like this smarmy, we're-funny-celebrities-acting-silly, unoriginal dogfart. Don't waste your time. Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson are weak and insipid, two guys merely cashing in.

What starts out as a funny buddy flick quickly degenerates into an overlong, cliche-ridden, racist, homophobic mess. It's disturbing how this turd is raking in the millions. In an attempt to exploit it's R rating, the film often crosses the line of funny and enters into the territory of the tasteless. Which is a real shocker, for Owen Wilson and Vince Vaughn share a knack for comedy, timing and chemistry which the movie has no idea how to use. Rachel McAdams is stunning, her smile alone deserves a better film.

I had heard from a couple of respected sources that this was a "hill-LARRY-us" movie, so I went into it expecting some laughs. I have an appreciation for the occasional "dumb" movies and "adult" humor, but this movie was chockablock with giant plot holes, obvious stereotypes (yawn!), and was waaay too long (double yawn!) getting to the obvious conclusion. I think I was creeped out by guys their age with reasonable careers doing such incredibly dumb things that they should've gotten out of their systems 15+ years prior! I've seen the two leads do much better in other movies (but paired with other people). Maybe it's just a matter of taste (I liked "Starsky and Hutch", so what does that say?!), but if you didn't like "Old School", you can pretty much count on disliking this one too!
I agree with Mack S. but give it 1 less point because it wasn't even funny. If this is what counts for humor these days than I guess we really are mindless zombies.
I saw the Unrated version, and I can't say that I could have been more displeased. Bad sex comedy that only turns funny with cliche jokes.

Wedding Crashers is one funny ass movie. Great Script, good acting (even by Owen Wilson), and smart. Unlike most stupid comedies that just use cuss words every minute, Wedding Crashers puts these words perfectly in their place.
Instant classic. All these other user reviews that give the movie like less than 5, get your **** head examined. You know you wanna laugh at this ****
A really great movie, and Vince Vaugh and Owen Wilson are gorgeous in their role as wedding crashers. I've seen it lots of times. I like it! I like it!
Dude this movie really rocks, it made me cry when I laughed so hard. From the second it began I loved it. It's so delicously funny just say "I Do" to Wedding crashers?
Wedding Crashers is a slick, hilarious, and memorable comedy. Vince Vaughn shows he's worth watching and Owen Wilson is the same old awesome blonde we all know. It won't fail to disappoint.
Im pretty sure with two funny guys this movie could've been acceptable.Only on drugs you can laugh more than three times on this movie.

A cute movie with a pretty good story and acting. However I thought this movie was going to be very funny and it ended up not being that funny. With two hilarious actors of Vaughn and Wilson this movie could have been really funny. An ok movie with a couple good jokes and a good dramatic story.
Best comedy of the year (2005). Could not stop laughing. WOW. All in all a must.
I liked the movie, it was funny and that what it was made for. Vince Vaughn is now pretty well-known and deservingly so; hes a funny man.

It's Wedding Crashers, guys! It's a funny movie! It's one of the top 10 favorites among college campuses on facebook! And....Vince Vaughn! And...Owen Wilson! Plus the redhead chick and the chick from the Notebook!
Hilarious.
1 funny film...didnt think i would like it at first but it completely changed my opinion...never judge a book by its cover !!
Great comedy. Even if you don't like sex jokes, you'll still smirk at its stupidity!
The film is cleverly written and expertly performed, especially by Wilson, Vaughn, and Walken. Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson are perfectly matched and are excellent together.
I am still laughing. This movie was not serious at all and I liked that, except for the end where it tried (and failed) but you gotta love it.

This movie is not for the overly religious, or people with weak morals. This movie is a well smart out comedy, with some better writing than we've seen in the past. Movies like this can be a dime a dozen, or come out as a bad sitcom cliche. However the wedding crashers does have some genuinely good moments, and the story isn't completely convoluted with bad comedy cliches. Overall: 7.4 Good.
This movie was not half as funny as I thought it would be. Also, too many curse words. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone.

Two friends spend their days crashing weddings to pickup chicks. Until one of them meets the girl of their dreams that is. What follows is a pretty funny disastrous stay with some truly crazy people. While one guy tries to woe the girl, the other gets punished for his lothario ways. They both end up taking their lumps in the end though. Regularly funny and benefiting from the comedic chemistry between Wilson and Vaughn, the only real problem with this movie is it's over-reliance on formula for the plot. You can predict how the whole thing is going to play out. Guy makes girl question her current relationship, guy's lies get found out, he gets depressed, and everything works out in the end. While you know the route it's going to take, it doesn't make things any less funny. The sharp dialog and crazy, ridiculous scenarios still make for a solid comedy.

This isn’t a fluid and straight shooting comedy, but ‘Wedding Crashers’ manages to push out enough laughs to make this easily enjoyable and often a genuinely funny. But these genuine moments are comprised of smaller moments that happen in the broader scheme, there are a lot of things going on to the point where many characters get left behind, but I’ll get to that. We meet Jeremy and John, played by the excellent comedy duo of Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson, a pair of wedding crashers, there is no catch here, this is what they actually do, besides being lawyers, they crash an obscene amount of weddings as a way to bed various lucky ladies who are present at the wedding, then they move on, some of these scenes are terrific as they fake their way into the ceremony and then deliver the goods in the reception. The real punch comes in the form of Treasury Secretary Clearly, who is played by none other than Christopher Walken, this guy can make anything sound funny, yet he is grossly underused in this comedy, is that even possible? But even so, Jeremy and John are after the daughters of the man, seeing this as the jackpot, they get in quite deep, Jeremy (Vaughn) seduces the crazy and unstable Gloria (Isla Fisher) while John falls for the irresistible Claire (Rachel McAdams). But Claire has a fiancee, the not very nice Sack (Bradley Cooper), who is just quite uncomfortable to watch in each scene he is in, Cooper is a phenomenal actor, but his role in this film is jarring and distracting. The bum note of the film is the opportunities it misses, dragging out scenes for longer than they should and not giving enough for Walken to do, but the film has excellent moments with Vaughn and Wilson on top form, they often stray off in perfect comic timing which unfortunately loses steam as the film ticks on, there is a lot of talent that is underused, such as Henry Gibson playing a priest who doesn’t really have much to do apart from making various faces to show shock or other emotions at stories he is told, or the forgotten son, Todd (Keir O’Donnell), who has many funny moments and setups, but ultimately these don’t amount to much. One of the highlights actually comes from a small role for Will Ferrell, playing the master of the wedding crashing game, his moments on screen are comedy gold but just don’t last long enough. In the midst, this is still a funny film, it has plenty of gags that work in relation to the film and has its fair share of top notch scenes, particularly more candid ones amongst the talent rather than she they are all in the same room at the same time.The idea and some of the delivery is there, this has an all star cast but simply loses track too many times which leaves its consistency in the gutter, but some decent performances and also some side splitting moments make this enjoyable enough, but a bit too long for its misplacement.

Wedding Crashers at first promises to be a crude guy comedy, but somewhere down the line morphs into an overly predictable chick flick. If you're looking for jokes, there are a few laughs. If you're looking for sentiment, there's some of that as well. But neither the jokes or the sentiment really take off into anything exceptional.

Such a low class piece of junk. Except for like one scene, everything else is stupid. I absolutely hate the two main characters. I highly suggest you don't waste your time watching this obnoxious "comedy". Go read a book or something.

Although there are some evident plot and character believability issues throughout, "Wedding Crashers" still remains an amusingly lewd comedy with some affecting scenes of sentimentality and a pretty fantastic performance from a young and (at the time) unknown Bradley Cooper.
Funny and light, "The Wedding Crashers" is a predictable but enjoyable film.

This is a very clever movie that is carried by Vaughn and Wilson's great chemistry, there are also very nice performances from the supporting cast especially Bradley Cooper in his breakout role. A very funny cameo from Will Ferrell by the way

Wedding Crashers has some good ideas but the movie is not as funny as he pretends to be.The stereotype characters are not really funny and Vince Vaughn's performance is not that good but the movie is still enjoyable.

Granted, this movie is entertaining and fun to watch in an i'm-really-bored-and-there's-nothing-else-to-watch-on-netflix kinda way, but other than that, very, very wrong. Misogynistic, sexist, homophobic, racist, no sign of ethnic diversity except for the servants (honestly?), gender biased, enforces gender roles and brutality, multiple rape jokes, literal sexual assault and sexual harassment (and more!), this movie is the epitome of a bad message to our society. But then again, so are pretty much all Hollywood movies.
i don't get custody..Wedding CrashersIt seems distracted from its track and is surprisingly long enough for you to wander off from the movie.
Really enjoyed this flick, thought the comedy concept was inventive, parts of movie quite funny.
Well good film. Owen Wilson and Vince Vaughn made the film work. So funny and easy to watch. i am buying this just because so easy to watch and a good laugh.

C'mon - have some real fun! Didn't you know some guys who made you laugh and were always the life of the party? Well - now they are on the big screen! We should all live with them for at least a month per year - break out, and just have plain FUN!

" You have got to see this MOvie!!" " It is Funny As hell !!" Those are some of the things I've heard about this movie. And when i finally rented it. Dissapointing indeed. Giving this movie a 5 is very generous of me. Why do I? It had it's moments. But I do have to say. That the dinner scene everyone was always talking about, was mediocre. The only other reason This movie gets a 5 from me of course is none other then Cristopher Walken. He does not have to be funny. all he's got to do is just talk..viola...Funny. Do not bother bying this movie.. rented and burn it if you have to. but dont buy it.

The most hilarious, laugh out loud, movie I have seen in years. Yet, it is also heart felt. This film has every component a viewer would want and it does so with ease. I was not a big fan of Will Ferrell
A comedy with laughs. Unusual.

I just wanted to say that Kimberly Jones is clearly on crack..and it sounds like i'd need a couple drinks or some pharmaceutical assistance to hang out with her. Maybe I should apply for her position at the Houston Chronicle.
Solid. About 25 minutes too long though...
THIS MOVIE TOTALLY ROCKED!! Its very; moch a guy; movie in the begining but after the first 5 minutes every one in the theater will be having a great time. it is absolutly hysterical.

probably 8.5. This movie was a lot funnier than i thought it would be. It was actually funny the first time around, unlike movies like anchorman and The 40 year old virgin, in which i found funnier the second time watching. My praises go to vince for his character. Owen had moments, but vince drove the movie.
